result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Hills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements
Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CM416 & 16CM203 called together at 9:09 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Joseph M Hills in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall confirms victim rights compliance, no request to be heard; Court finds Chapter 950 compliance
 
Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CM416; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #
1-16CM203 and bars it from further prosecution, jeopardy attaches

On Count #1-15CM416, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions as set forth in the case settlement document, which include:
--Any assessment, treatment or counseling as directed by DOC
--No possession of any dangerous weapon
--Complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming if recommended by Department of Corrections
--No acts or threats of violence
--No possession/ingestion of alcohol
--Fine and/or costs
--Domestic abuse surcharge
--DNA Surcharge
WITH ADDITION:
-Court appointed Attorney fees
DNA Sample not ordered as It determines Mr. Hills already has DNA on file

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 9:30 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Bond Payment Information
Surety Information

Cases 15CM416 & 16CM203 called at 11:03 am
Defendant Joseph M Hills in court, in custody.  ADA John Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Fryatt advises that the defendant failed to appear on May 10, 2016 in Br. 3.
Defendant advises that he doesn't remember his Attorneys name, but that his attorney told him to appear today.
Court advises the defendant of court procedure.
ADA Fryatt advises the Court that in 15CM416 the defendant failed to appear on May 9 and the warrant was stayed until the next morning, the defendant failed to appear on the 10 and the warrant was issued.

Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court 15CM416 court continues the bond.

On 16CM203: 
Court requires $100.00  CASH bond, withsame non-monetary conditions: 
--no contact with Libby Cabot
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

Recess: 11:25 am
NEXT: (1) Plea and Sentencing scheduled for 6/16/16 at 9:15 am
Defendant appeared in custody

Cases 15CM416 and 16CM203 called together at 10:21am
Atty. Stroschein appears in court. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Stroschein indicates that she was unable to reach Mr. Hills yesterday or this morning to notify him of todays hearing.
Atty. Stroschein requests an adjournment

The Court bench warrants in both cases, body only. 
The Court directs the Clerk to remove the Jury Trial from the calendar.
recess: 10:26am
and Authorization to Act and Appear

Cases 15CM416 and 16CM203 called together at 4:01pm [mo]
Attorney Teri Strohschein in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Strohschein submits a notice of retainer and authorization to appear.

Attorney Strohschein indicates that a resolution has been reached on both cases; requests a plea and sentencing hearing
The Court indicates that it will not remove the Jury Trial from the calendar until a plea is entered.
The Court directs that Mr. Hillls is to appear tomorrow between 8:00am and 11:00am to enter a plea; Atty. Strohschein indicates that she will be in court at 10:00am tomorrow
recess: 4:06am
FINANCIAL NOTES:  $100.00 gps payment received - Attorney fees

Case called at 8:16am [mo]
Defendant Joseph M Hills in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.

The Court address lack of payment towards court appointed attorney fees with Mr. Hills
The Court orders that Mr. Hills inquire of the COC how to make payment by mail
The Court orders Mr. Hills to pay $100 to the COC by Tuesday April 22 at 4:00pm
The Court adjusts the payment of attorney fees so that on the 27th day of each month, beginning with May, Mr. Hills will pay $100 towards his court appointed attorney fees.
recess: 8:26am

Case called at 11:11 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Joseph M Hills in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $150 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No presence at W6037 Riess Rd. Aztalan
-No contact with Nicole Cave
-No acts or threats of violence
-No physical contact with Janelle Gard except for child exchanges as long as there is no name calling
-Can pick up possessions by November 9th and have contact with Janelle Gard as long as there is no violent contact or name calling
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Janelle Gard

Recess: 11:16 am for the Court to address another matter
Reconvene: 11:30 am
Court has colloquy with Mr. Hills re: no contact/discussion - Court clarifies bond conditions
